description:
Great neighborhood sushi with a very nice staff :) 
Great happy hour sushi as well!
Ask them make you the vegan sushi roll that they make for Robin- even non vegans love it! Super delicious!
author: Robin K.

description:
We found this amazing Sushi spot on Chestnut tonight. My best friend and I do a sushi date once a week. We were blown away by Sushi In...the flavor was spot on...the fish was perfectly cut and so fresh...the service was attentive without being overbearing...and the atmosphere was intimate and welcoming. 

Try the: 
Baked Muscles (so delicious!!!)
Spicy Garlic Edamame 
Nigiri (Sake and Hamachi Toro...so good we ordered two additional orders of the Hamachi) 
Rolls: 
Fireworks & Golden Spicy Tuna Roll
Topped all off with hot Sake on tap! 

Store front does not stand out...hoping they will add a sandwich board and big bright open sign...need this spot to survive! Seriously everything was amazing! 

Ps: Server advised us not to dip the Fireworks roll in the flaming hot alcohol...because apparently Marina knuckleheads have done this before! lol
author: Natasha A.

description: Great place to get delivery from. The sushi is always good and fresh and they are quick and efficient with delivery.
author: Rachel B.

description:
A friend of mine knowing that I love and somewhat knowledgeable about JP food introduced me to a JP restaurant in Richmond.  Therefore, we went there to try out this place in a group of 5.  A small and cute little JP restaurant that can approximately hold up to ~25 customers. (Reservation is recommended, glad that I did)

Summary
Food: 3.5 (I wanted to give them a 4, but due to their limited variety of seafood for that evening)
Service: 4 (Attentive and friendly, will never interrupt your conversation) 
Cleanliness: 4 (Very clean and tidy)
Price: 4 (reasonable)

Recommendation for starters: Deep Fried Baby Octopus, Chicken Kara-age, Mixed Tempura, Beef Tataki
 
Recommendation for rolls: Aloha Island, Samurai, Rock N Roll, Spicy Tuner
author: R L.

description: i was totally craving sushi on a sunday night and ordered postdates from sushi in. i was pleasantly surprised with the quality and deliciousness. I had the 49ers roll, the chestnut roll, salmon toro, and chu toro. the toro melts in your mouth! they were also very accommodating to my sesame seeds allergy.
author: Hayley Z.

description: I was looking forward to some delicious sushi since it was so hot. And the rolls came out warm! Gross! Couldn't even finish it. Hope I don't get food poisoning.
author: Amanda J.

description:
Ordered delivery from Sushi In via Eat 24 a couple nights ago and I gotta say, it was a really seamless experience and the food arrived much earlier than expected. I've dined inside Sushi In once before, so I figured after this delivery it was time to write a quick review. 

Look. The sushi is good, it's not mind bending by any means but, like my other "casual" sushi restaurant reviews it's important to remember that casual sushi spots exist for one main reason, a cheap sushi fix. 

I ordered a few of the standard "filler" rolls like the spicy tuna, kappa maki, tekka maki, etc. which were all pretty good. The maguro was super fresh and enjoyed it very much. I also ordered a couple rolls with Hamachi (Yellow Tail) and the fish was a bit tougher in texture that I'm normally used to, but passable for sure. 

For an affordable Tuesday night Eat 24 delivery option, you can't go wrong.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Different version, but still good!

I remember a few years back when there was another Sushi Bar on this very location which was pretty good, but I suppose they left. The good news is that Sushi In which replaced them is just as good. 

On my first visit to Sushi In I stuck to Nigiri Sushi and Miso Soup (curtsy of Yelp check-in!) and loved it. For Desserts I had Green Tea Ice cream; love that too. My girlfriend ordered Beef Teriyaki and she was not as excited! I tried a couple of pieces and I must admit I've had better. 

The service was good. The young lady that attended to us was very good at what she did and we never felt ignored.

The prices were reasonable as well.

Bottom line, Sushi In is good place to have sushi if you are around the neighborhood.
author: Afshin A.

description: Love the rolls the waitress was very nice it's a small cute little sushi place with high-quality fish and a nice appetizer menu lots of variety I am excited to come back it was very unfortunate they did not have uni today
author: Stacey T.

description: I was really craving a salmon avocado roll one night and this place totally hit the spot. For affordable sushi, this place seems to have pretty fresh/decent quality fish. Plus, bonus: they have this amazing green tea cheesecake on the menu!
author: Alice S.

description: Perfect Kappa Maki. Awesome nigiri and sashimi. Solid list of sake. Bonus: If you're within a 1 mile radius, you can order directly from Sushi In. No app needed.
author: Jesse P.

description:
Great sushi bar ! Good quality sushi and menu items.   Love coming here about once a week- 

Also a nice place to escape the busy city and get a quite dinner.
They do a lot of takeout orders so they have lots of fresh fish all the time while the restaurant is always nice a quite! 
Early happy hour to!! They open at 430 which is awesome on days you skip lunch and want a early dinner!!
Keep up the good food!!
author: L T.

description:
We were lured here by the idea of happy hour sushi. The fish was sub-par (the "yellowtail" looked like frozen, bleached tuna, frosty pink coloured with no veining and an unrecognisable flavour to match), as I suppose would be expected from such a special, but we went on to order a few items from the regular menu and were driven even further from impressed.

Hopefully someone who reads this review will save themselves some saliva by AT LEAST avoiding their beef tataki. Absolutely w a s t e d m o n e y. It was not only overcooked, tough, and over salted, but the meat had that weird metallic sheen on it from when beef gets days old (somehow it was able to appear to have a red patch in the middle, but it tasted like crusty sundried leather). We ate only one piece each, left the rest til the end, and then were pushing each other to consume the remaining pieces since no one had any desire for more yet we couldn't stand to waste the money. I've never had such difficulty eating at a sushi restaurant, and to be clear I have no problem eating low budget if it's not terrible. This was actually regrettable.

To be fair, the pictures I'm seeing on yelp are extremely different from what we received from sushi In, and I would hope that we just hit them on an off day. I came because of the pictures, and I feel like I still have no idea what restaurant must have produced them. I'm willing to believe that they have other chefs and products available at other times. However, I still remember the taste of that ratty beef as I walked out the door, and it is not an experience I'd ever be keen to repeat.
author: Alice L.

description: This is our new go-to delivery place for sushi. They use a perfect amount of rice for their rolls and nigiri. The sushi combination is my favorite!
author: Mary A.

description: Really great sashimi and lovely service! Definitely keeping this place in regular rotation
author: Laura L.

description:
Before going to the Palace of Fine Arts for an Escape Room, my bf and I wanted to find a place nearby where we could find a quick bite to eat. After doing a quick Yelp search, we found this place.

We only had to wait a few minutes for another table to finish up and then we were seated. When you check in on Yelp, you can get a free miso soup, so we each ordered one. We also got the six piece sashimi sampler and the beef tataki roll. The sashimi was cut on the thicker side, but was very fresh. The beef tataki roll was unlike anything I've had before, but it was delicious. Thin cut beef over an avocado, asparagus, and cucumber roll topped with a tiny piece of pineapple.

The service was quick and the food was pretty good. It seemed like a lot of people were ordering delivery or takeout because there was always one or two bags of food being prepared while we were there.
author: Leana L.

description:
Fresh sashimi.  Small entrée portions but reasonable price.  Not a big place but cozy.
Good service.
author: Mike W.

description:
Surprisingly a solid sushi place. I honestly thought they'd be a mediocre sushi joint in the Marina. I was craving sushi, but didn't want to trek out to that area of Chestnut on a holiday. I decided to place a delivery for a sashimi platter and nigiri.

I wouldn't say that their sushi is the best in the area, but it's reasonably priced with decent cuts of fresh fish. My food arrived on time and they didn't forget about my request for extra wasabi and ginger :) 

Great low key spot for happy hour or when you want to grab a quick bite of sushi. The downside is that they only have indoor seating and can be quite dark inside.
author: Helen C.

description:
OMG! How fortunate were my husband and I to walk into Sushi In and receive the best food and the best service!
It was our anniversary and the restaurant we were supposed to go, was closed. We were going to see a comedy show, so time was essential.
The sushi chef created the most magnificent dishes for me accommodating my very special diet (I was on a detox)! This made it even more special. Cucumber wrapped sushi pieces and the ika was to die for. Very fresh, very delicious. Can't wait to return!
Highly recommended,
I forgot to take photos and that makes me somewhat sad.
author: Pamela F.

description: You never really want to get sushi delivered.  But sometimes the kids just want to stay in the room, so if you're going to get sushi delivered - this is your spot.  Very good for delivery sushi.  Nothing extraordinary, but then again we are used to Uchi and Kuu in Houston, so we are spoiled sushi-wise.  Stay away from hot items and go for sashimi bowls - the Hamachi over rice was decent, 8 thick slices on sushi rice, again nothing earth shattering but got the job done, and very fresh tasting.  The rolls were just ok, the beef roll lacked texture/flavor, we didn't even finish it.  The kids gobbled up 3 orders of CA rolls with real crab, and the other rolls were passable although nothing special.  Another idea is to take the kids with and put them on ipads while Mom and Dad eat, we did that today and it worked great.
author: Rob K.

description: I really liked this place in the past but they are very flakey when it comes to online orders
author: Chris C.

description: Great happy hour prices! Their sushi is consistently good and the staff is friendly.
author: Tara M.

description: Solid menu and very fresh fish.  Owner operator Jackie is outstanding.
author: Philip D.

description: Small/cute little restaurant next to Smitten ice cream on Chestnut.  My friend and I had the Iceland roll, spicy tuna roll, spider roll and seafood sunomo salad.  All were so good.  My favorite was the Iceland roll..light but creamy and rich in flavor!  Sushi/ rolls cuts were perfect with the right amount of rice (sometimes rolls are too big with way too much rice).  Next time I'm going to try their nigiri.
author: Esther L.

description: This place is pretty darn good! My wife and I were walking down Chestnut and decided to give it a shot and were pleasantly surprised. Every thing we ordered tasted amazing. Recommend the salmon and yellowtail toro. They also have the best 49er roll I've had in the city other than Sugoi. The Garlic Tataki Roll is really good too! Check it out brothers and sisters!!!
author: Stephen C.

description:
Came here after a full day of moving in to a new apartment. It's a small restaurant with a few tables and a sushi bar, but the food is fantastic!

The rolls are all very unique and creative. The Fireworks was especially good - spicy but delicious!
Highly recommend the spicy garlic edamame too!
author: Nico C.

description: I come here pretty often now because of how yummy the food is! I get myself the usual miso soup, philadelphia roll, and then choose from one of their other special rolls. I get nice and full just by those 3 dishes. I am really picky when it comes to  raw fish. I know when it's high quality the second it enters my mouth lol!This will be my regular spot for sushi :)
author: Sarah M.

description: This place is great, I was walking by one day an then I noticed the happy hour sign. I came in and dined in while visiting with someone. You can taste how fresh the fish is, straight out of the sea. What got me the most was the pricing of the sushi during happy hour! I'll definitely be putting this one in my book for dining in for sushi!
author: Mike K.

description: Love this place. Great neighborhood sushi spot and the folks that work here couldn't be nicer. Love their fried tuna roll, miso soup and seaweed salad and any of heir specials are awesome.
author: Julie K.

description: Love this place! Always tasty the freshest fish. Lovely staff. Easy to find a table on Friday :-)
author: Nelly A.

description:
Best Sushi on Chestnut by far!!!  P.S. for REAL Sushi Eaters

I have been going to Sushi-In 1-2 times per week for the last 2 years and this is why:
1. Some of the best uni in town - the pieces are huge, super fresh and Sushi-In is the only restaurant in town carrying the "Gold" quality Mendocino Uni (at the moment). 
2. Highest Quality Sushi Happy Hour in Town (M-F 4:30-6pm)! GIANT hand rolls for $3, large pieces of FRESH Hamachi for $2 ea, $4 large hot sake ( I know.... I prefer cold too, but it's $4). 
3. VERY FRESH- They receive seafood shipments everyday so the quality is consistently excellent. 
4. Fabulous staff who LOVES children (I don't see children there often, but they have hello kitty cups ready) - My 5 year old daughter's favorite place to go. 

While the selection is not as interesting as Kappa, Kabuto or Zushi Puzzle, what they do have is consistently fabulous and much less expensive (just as good and sometimes better).  

Yesterday I ordered Uni, O-Toro and some happy hour Nigiri with my daughter (who eats as much as me). We walked out the door with a $32 bill.  Nowhere in San Francisco serves up this quality for this price! 

That said, if you are looking for a marina scene or you like low quality rolls you are likely to be disappointed.  Because Sushi-in carries such high quality seafood, the rolls are more expensive relative to other places in the area that stuff their rolls with less fresh seafood.  If you can't tell the difference, save your money and go somewhere else.  Perhaps Ace?
author: Megan M.

description: Coming from Tucson, AZ I thought this place was great. Different.   It was small and what I thought a San Fransisco sushi place might be.  The chefs seemed so detailed and focused in every effort they made.  Loved my 49ers roll! Will definitely come back
author: Alexander Z.

description: I got my food fast and fresh... the costumer service was great and my order was on time.. I didn't wait that much. Thank you
author: Juan R.

description: Just ordered off grub hub. Food came on time and was fresh and delicious . Had the real crab California roll and one of there seated salmon specialty rolls . I will definitely be ordering from here again !
author: Valerie P.

description: I love this place. Great sushi, reasonable price, and you can order online through Yelp!
author: Leia V.

description:
I have had dinner and HH here. For dinner, the price is meh. For HH, it is definitely worth it...$3 and $4 rolls, $2 and $3 apps, $3-$5 drinks? Yes, please! The mismo soup is $2 during HH, and def worth to get. 

If you are in the Marina during HH hours, I definitely recommend checking it out. It's not the best sushi, the place is little small, but definitely hits the sushi spot (especially the price) during HH hours. 

Oh, and sit by the "bar" it's fun!
author: Sonia A.

description: I ordered food for delivery at work, since it's pretty close by. The food was cold and the teriyaki chicken had no sauce/teriyaki flavor. I got the teriyaki entree with rice and salad and miso soup - at least the salad was good but not for $20+. Never ordering from here again.
author: Shira S.

description:
Updating my review now that I've tried more sushi spots in the area. Don't get me wrong. The In is solid. But it's just not quite 4 stars. Service is okayyy but not amazing. Rolls are good, not amazing. And ambiance is well... trying too hard to be a sushi club.

If you're looking for a place you can just pop in and out of, this would be a good option. But if you're really looking for quality, I would recommend Zushi Puzzle or Ace Wasabi.
author: Rachel L.

description:
The fish was bad... So bad that I spit it out before swallowing on the first bite.  We went back to request a refund on our take out order (First time ever anywhere). They get one star for the easy refund, which made me even more uneasy...it had seemed like they were used to costumers returning orders. 

Needless to say, we won't be going back again. There are too many places with fresh fish.
author: Kindra W.

description: Always friendly, good quality and has place to sit, not a chain restaurant. It became my place after yoga. Since a few years of visits I never regretted it.
author: Diana R.

description:
A diamond in the rough! This small but mighty sushi joint impressed us with their  super fresh fish, lovely presentation, and friendly, efficient service. The nigiri was not overstuffed with rice, providing a perfectly-sized bundle of oceanic delight. 
There were several unique "fish of the day" specials that tasted fresh off the hook. 

Had the server provided us with the standard before-meal oshibori, and poured my husband's beer into his glass, we'd have granted the 5th star.
author: Bonnie B.

description: Amazing happy hour specials! The sushi was delicious and made so quickly. We got the tuna hand roll and Alaskan roll. Both tasted so fresh! Would definitely go back if we didn't live on the other side of the country!
author: Victoria R.

description:
Just left Sushi IN. It was DEEEELICIOUS!

This is my new favorite Japanese restaurant in the city. The decor is welcoming but good for first dates too. I love the colors everywhere! 

My boyfriend and I got soooo much food. and EVERYTHING was perfect.
author: Bianca W.

description: good place, new items just came out, tried filet mignon and Sesame Tuna Tataki with Tom Yum Sauce, taste so good
author: Johnny Y.

description: Took forever to deliver. Called in and was told they were 10 mins away which was not true. Total delivery time was around an hour and a half.
author: Bernardo d.

description:
This place was great! The fish was fresh, the presentation was beautiful, and the service was on point. The waitress was even educated about sustainable choices on their menu. Also, not often do servers come back to ask if anyone at the table needs anything before I've already waved them over.

I heard their happy hours are great, and it looks like a good deal but I'll never be able to make it because it ends at 6pm. What a shame... 

Their prices are completely reasonable and somewhat of a steal for the location and quality you get.

If you plan to check this place out, make sure to take advantage of the Yelp deal going on ($20 worth for $10)!
author: Karen C.

description: My go-to place for delivery. I'm not sure how things are if you dine-in but everything from the ordering experience, to the friendliness of the delivery people, to the quality of the food has been amazing.
author: Ana C.

description:
Got to this restaurant just before happy hour.  We ordered some drinks and rolls at happy hour prices.  For some reason, in the dinner hours, we were the only table seated for quite a while.  I don't know if that's a good thing or bad.  The service was prompt and attentive.

The food was tasty.  We ordered the regular sashimi and thought it would have come with some rice, but it didn't.  Their spicy tuna and unagi rolls were excellent.

When the bill came, it wasn't priced as happy hour pricing.  We brought it up to our waitress and she corrected the receipt accordingly.
author: Wally W.

description:
The best sushi in SF...or actually anywhere! Staff is great, chefs are excellent and owners make you feel like you're in their kitchen. 
Hamachi Karpachio
Super white tuna anything (sashimi, hand roll...)
Iceland roll
Fireworks

I come here at least once a week...excessive? Yes, but when you have a craving, it won't leave your mind.
author: Matheson J.

description:
Sushi in the Marina is like getting shitty ice cream in the middle of the desert:  It sucks, but man, it's there, and you'll take whatever you can get.

Unseasoned and overcooked edamame - seriously, WHAT decent Japanese restaurant nowadays doesn't season the shell (even a teeny pinch of salt would help) and then let it steam for so long that the beans are close to being mush?

Bland, small little baby gyoza.  Did I really just pay a dollar per anorexic gyoza?  Even the dipping sauce didn't help.

Good sake don (salmon over rice), because the fish was very fresh, and the rice was dotted with fish eggs and sesame.  However, for $16 a pop, I'm going to need a bigger portion.  Same goes for Boyfriend's chirashi, which was an $18 small bowl of rice and about 4 kinds of fish, plus a small piece of octopus and shrimp.

Sushi IN is clearly a sushi-only place, as their hot food items were very, very limited (teriyaki chicken, a few other broiled fish dishes); they didn't even have any noodle dishes, which is really what I'd been looking for on a cold drizzly evening.

This place is small but not cozy.  I felt a draft around my legs the entire time I was eating at the back table.  Service was attentive and nice, but it was expected since we were one of three pairs sitting in the restaurant (around 8 pm Monday).

Probably my favorite out of the other nearby sushi places off Chestnut (Ace, Naked Fish), but Sushi IN will probably not be getting a second go until I've exhausted my sushi options in the area.
author: Tori S.

description:
DELICIOUS, FRESH FISH, AND BEAUTIFUL PRESENTATION!

i came here with a large group so i was able to try out a lot of different things on the menu. there really was not a single thing that disappointed me, but of course there are always favorites

*shrimp tempura - i love the tempura batter here. its really light and crispy. you actually taste the shrimp and yam rather than a whole bunch of batter

*beef teriyaki - another dish i almost never get but this was one actually of my favorite dish of the night! beef teriyaki is usually so boring to me and i do not like sweet meat, but the beef teriyaki here is rib eye meat and it is cooked perfectly! its super tender and juicy. the teriyaki sauce on top isnt too sweet and is something good enough to eat alone with rice.

i love sushi rolls however it sucks when the sashimi is not fresh and sushi chefs drench their sushi rolls with sauce, which happens at a lot of restaurants but not here at SUSHI IN. we got a few basic ones which were all good, but some of SUSHI IN's signature rolls really stood out to me

*firecracker - shrimp tempura topped with spicy ahi tuna, jalapeno and habanero. in my experience, almost all the spicy rolls ive had are made spicy usually cause it has a lot of sriracha. but with this roll, there wasn't much sauce and you can taste all the fresh ingredients. the flame on the side is a nice touch as well

*golden spicy tuna - spicy tuna deep fried with jalapeno and eel and spicy sauce. another good spicy roll without too much sauce to mask the tuna fish flavor and not heavily battered

*samurai - seared fresh fish with asparagus and avocado. my first time having a roll with asparagus in it and it was really good! the fish on top of the roll was seared nicely - still raw but has a nice crust on the outside, and was a good combination with the crunchy asparagus.

even though there isn't much to look at when it comes to pieces of raw fish, owner/sushi chef Jacky really takes his time on his presentation. the sashimi is fresh and nice and buttery tasting. the salmon and super white tuna sashimi were my two favorites. and unlike some other restaurants, these sashimi pieces are thick! 

being a new sushi restaurant in SF, people may think "oohh anotherrrr sushi place?" but SUSHI IN really is a great restaurant because the owners, the chefs, and waitress are all so welcoming and enthusiastic. Jacky puts in a lot of passion and hard work into his dishes and it does show.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I am a huge sushi fanatic and was anticipating the opening of Sushi In. I've had a lot of sushi in my life but nothing comes close to the presentation at this quaint place. The sushi looked gorgeous and was absolutely amazing. The fish was incredibly fresh and I was surprised that THIS is what real sushi tastes like.

I've been going to a lot of sushi places around the Marina and find all the rolls pretty much the same - boring. Sushi In is def my new spot! Try the firework roll if you like spicy!!
author: Lauren W.

description:
Sushi IN is def. more of a 2.5 - close to a 3.  Just wasn't anything to die for awesome about this place - other than their side salad - talk about HUGE and gorgeous - beautifully sliced avocado & tom w long straws of carrots and beautifully plated.  I know - I just gave props to a side salad.

The service was the SLOWEST - I mean 5-10 minutes to get water after asking for it repeatedly - come on now.  

Sashimi was just alright, chicken teriyaki was alright, everything was just borderline alright.  I was actually antsy to leave.  

Cute space and nicely decorated.  

Had some classic  Marina-clueless girls sitting next to us talking about their opinion on snowboarding vs. skiing - I nearly died of laughter on their lack of knowledge on the sports.
author: Jana S.

description:
This was some good sushi.  I'm talking that melt in your mouth, super fresh, buttery type of goodness.  We had a couple of the rolls and unfortunately I don't remember which ones, but I definitely remember they were good.  We also had the chef's selection and were really impressed.  

quick tip - this spot is a tiny little place.
author: Chloe M.

description:
I was looking for a place large enough for my birthday dinner, and this place did the trick! It's a little easy to overlook at first glance: I know I definitely would've missed it had I not been looking for it, and one of my good friends couldn't find it altogether.

Started with the calamari, which was just okay, and a bottle of sake for the table. This is definitely more of a sushi place (than general Japanese food) - they only had a few non-sushi items on the list, which was fine by me as I'm a fan of sushi. One of my friends ordered the teriyaki chicken and she seemed to be happy with it. The rest of us ordered 4 rolls to share: Mango Madness, Beef Tataki, TKO, and... one other I can't remember the name of. All of the rolls were delicious and we left happy and very full.
author: Sarah B.

description: This is what winning tastes like. Seriously, this is probably the best sushi restaurant in the city. I'm surprised it isn't packed all the time. Order the Murray Roll if you're not afraid to ride the lightening.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Tried this place last night after catching a movie at the Marina theatre. We really enjoyed it, would have liked it more if it was during Happy Hour, but next time =). I like spicy so wanted to try the Fireworks but for some reason habanero just sounded like a bit much w/ the wasabi. 

We started with the gyoza, it was alright, when is it ever really amazing though? If anyone knows, tell me. Then we had the Golden Spicy Tuna Roll and the African Spider. Both were great, but def loved the African Spider!

Quite Monday night, only a couple people in the place, service was friendly and attentive (I drink an annoying amount of water) and place was very clean. Be back for happy hour soon!
author: Cyndi C.

description: If you are looking for pleasant sushi experience look no further than Sushi In in Marina! Tastefully made rolls, geometrically pleasing nigiri and excellent selection of vegetarian rolls for very reasonable price make this place a true gem of crowded San Francisco's sushi scene! Highly recommend!!!
author: Dmitri G.

description: Our sushi was good, not great. I probably wouldn't eat here again. The takeout was just as good as when we ate in the restaurant, so they don't keep your dinner sitting around.
author: Mitch C.

description: I REALLY enjoy this place. I've had a surprisingly hard time finding good sushi/Japanese in The Marina and this place never fails. AND they are open on Sundays!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Sushi was good and delivery was fast and easy. Good for a late night craving but nothing too special from what I had. 

Spicy tuna basic role was good - lots of rice, which I don't love and not very spicy. 
Golden spicy tuna role was better - lightly fried and much spicier than its basic cousin. Don't like Tobiko so remember it's all over everything.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Got delivery from Sushi In for the first time tonight, and definitely won't be giving them any more business in the future.

$13 Rainbow Roll with fake crab meat??? Menu said "crab and avocado top with 5 kinds of fish".  BS.

$16 for Signature TKO roll..."lightly fried salmon & avocado top with white fish served w/habanero massago, chili oil and ponzu sauce".  Lightly fried salmon turned out to be overcooked, deep fried, dry salmon in the middle of the roll. That plus no chili oil or ponzu sauce on top made for a very dry roll.

Miso soup lacked any depth of flavor.

I know delivery sushi can be hit or miss, but this place doesn't even understand the basics. Definitely don't recommend.
author: Dan G.

description:
I Yelp searched for sushi delivery in the Marina, and Sushi IN is the highest rated of the 10 results I received. I proceeded to their website and started to fill out an online order, entering my items, my address, credit card, etc. but the website would not let me submit my order. It kept saying something was wrong with my address, which I triple checked. So I started over and ordered over the phone, ordering the exact same items. 

The delivery guy shows up pretty fast, runs my card, and I sign and tip. But after he leaves I take a closer look at the receipt and see that I was charged 10 dollars more than what the website said I was going to be charged, for the exact same items, and there isn't a delivery fee listed.

We open our bag and there are no chop sticks, napkins, soy sauce, and only 1 of our 2 soups. 

The sushi was OK overall, but the soft shell crab was absolutely disgusting. We each had a bite then through it out.

Will never order again.

TL;DR: website is broken, was overcharged, forgot a soup, forgot chopsticks, forgot soy sauce.
author: Captain B.

description:
Two types of toro sashimi? I say yes! I'm usually lucky to find one on a menu. And the hamachi carpaccio -- to die for.

Trendy and fun atmosphere, the outdoor light show makes it feel like you're stepping inside of nightclub rather than a sushi bar. 

Our waitress was super knowledgeable, friendly and incredibly prompt. They even accommodated our special request to swap some of the sashimi choices in the dinner special, for the types of sashimi that we prefer. (for a small charge). That never happens.

The baked mussels were deliciously spicy and awesome too, if you're looking to get warmed up.

Oh, and it's less expensive than other options on Chestnut, and less pretentious. Again, I say yes :-)
author: Annie K.

description:
Attentive service from our server and very accommodating sushi chefs! Not a fan of drinking, but they're hot sake was really good! 

Started off with their house salad, which was big enough to share, and also quite nutritious ( a bed of mixed greens, not the cheap iceberg lettuce that most places serve, julianned-carrots, sliced tomatoes, and sliced avocados).

Huge fan of uni, so had an uni handroll, uni sashimi, and uni nigiri; fairly sized but would have prefered larger pieces. Their monkfish liver was also delicious; but i'm not a huge fan of sauce so I would omit that next time. The aemabi (sp?) fried fish heads were crisp and flavored well.

Also had an order of the African spider roll which was a California roll based with soft shell crab, topped with avocado and some sweet sauce; mediocre, would not order again. However, their soft shell crab is tasty itself (without all the sauce and California roll base), so I will definitely give that appetizer a try the next time..(the photo of the crab on yelp looked amazing, should have ordered that from the start)

Ended our meal with three pairs of mochi ice cream ( green tea, red bean and mango). They're flavors consisted of coffee, chocolate, mango, green tea, or red bean.

I also wanted to have some raw oysters...but they didn't have any :/
author: Shirley A.

description:
The reason I am giving this place 4 stars is because they don't have a large selection of sushi rolls. BUT...the rolls that they do are are excellent. Fresh, clean and tasty!

I feel like this place is still a hidden gem. It has a funky, club feel with crazy light shows on the outside and the whole interior is white and a little small but the sushi is what you come for.

I always start off with a cup of their miso soup. It is full of flavor and yummy tofu.

I am a BIG fan of the Fireworks roll which consists of shrimp tempura, habanero and jalapenos and the plate is literally on fire. 

If you are a fan of hamachi then get the Iceland roll

Their Alaska roll is simple but so fresh. Salmon, cucumber and avocado. What's not to like?

The pink lady and the Mango Madness are also my go-to rolls

And my friends love the beef takati roll. Never had it but they really enjoy it

Prices are great! I would totally reccomend you go here for an easy and yummy sushi meal
author: Whitney S.

description: This is a decent sushi spot if you are already in the area and want to grab food. It's def not a place I would go out of my way for. It's a good location but the sushi isn't ALL that stellar. It did pop up on my yelp feed so I assumed with some of the ratings it was worth it but it really just was your average run of the mill place. Nothing special! Try to go elsewhere.
author: Priya S.

description: Went for happy hour and it was AMAZING. Spicy edamame is a must and you can let go wrong with the gyoza. The hand rolls were made right in front of us and we're delicious. No complaints here!
author: Kate L.

description: Great artisan sushi! I recommend the Fireworks, Soft-Shell crab roll and Salmon Toro sushi.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Staying OUT.

Friendly service and appealing menu were a promising start. But I should have paid closer attention to the dubstep mood killer.

After much debate ordered the chef special Samurai roll. Usually can't go wrong with a medley of seared fish, veggies and sweet mustard sauce.

Tasted fine. My problem was with the $15 price tag. Roll needed to be twice as big, or twice as good or include complimentary edamame to be worth it.

Further points deducted for the neon decor (not my thing) and "Happy Ending" dessert menu. Some might chuckle. Find it a bit juvenile for a restaurant.

Hard two stars to give with the great staff. But I just don't play well with dubstep and overpriced sushi.
author: Jason B.

description:
Got food poisoning! Confirmed by my doctor less than 24 hours later from unsanitary conditions/raw fish consumption. 

Went here the first week of its opening, and was excited by a new neighborhood sushi joint, only to be paying for it later at night. I tend to blindly trust sushi restaurants with the cleanliness of their facilities and maybe this place just wasn't ready for customers yet. But once you get food poisoning at a restaurant, its hard to justify ever returning when there are so many other options out there.

FOOD:
Edamame- too salty
Rainbow Roll- tasted fine at the time 
Green Caterpillar- my vegetarian husband ordered this and said he's better off at Tataki

SERVICE:
The place was completely empty so we sat wherever we wanted, and service was fine although no one was enthusiastic about opening week.

AMBIENCE:
Very dark and quiet inside; it always looks closed from the outside

*The best part of this meal was running into an old friend from high school and catching up

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Not great sushi... 

This place had great reviews so I decided to try it. I'm not sure if the other sushi places I eat at are amazing, but this place did not impress me or compare. Would not recommend to a friend.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We haven't been here in almost a year, but were very glad we came back. The first thing my wife and I both noticed was the great taste of the house sake. It was fresh and flavorful. We decided to abandon (most) of our favorites and try some new menu items. We shared everything. 

We did order two of our favorite Japanese staples. The gyoza was perfectly browned on the two sides. The filling was nicely seasoned and juicy, and the dipping sauce was lighter and milder than most Japanese restaurants. We found the Kaiso (seaweed salad) very refreshing and particularly crunchy. As I mentioned in my first review , the seaweed salad here omits the red pepper flakes, but is quite refreshing and tasty without the heat. 

My wife wanted to try the Beef Tataki Roll. We have had lots of sushi in San Francisco since we moved here in 1976, but never had a maki without any fish in it. The overall taste of this roll was like heaven. The whole thing just melted in your mouth. However, the beef flavor was overwhelmed by the pineapple on top - a thinner slice of pineapple would have improved the balance, even though we gobbled it up. My wife also had a Shrimp Tempura roll which she said was the best she ever ate. The shrimp was very fresh and still crunchy inside the roll. We mentioned this to our hostess and she said that was because the tempura shrimp was made fresh for each order, not pre-fried and sitting around. 

I ordered a Chestnut Roll which I enjoyed very much. The tobiko topping was super fresh and just the right amount.  I wished I could taste the scallions, but could not. I also tried their signature Mango Madness, served last (for dessert?). In fact, it was very much a fruity sushi dessert, sweet, but very fruity and well-balanced flavors. 

I'd like to add that all these goodies were extremely well plated with lots of eye appeal, which whets the appetite and lends to their appreciation.  Very well done and appreciate by us for sure.  We'll be back again soon.
author: Eric S.

description:
Came in on a Sunday night and was seated quickly with no wait. I ordered the hamachi carpaccio, the african spider, and the firecracker. All three were great. My water and hot tea were refilled fairly often, my plates were cleared quickly, and my date was beautiful. What more could I ask for?

Didn't try any traditional sushi, so I can't really comment on the nigiri and sashimi. The rolls were good though. Somewhat similar to Sushi Bistro, but with less selection. My date ordered the salmon teriyaki entree. She didn't finish it, but I don't think it's because it didn't taste good. She loved the big salad and the miso soup that came with her entree as well.
author: Brian B.

description:
Amazing!!!

Great service, awesome food!!

Coming back next time I visit San Francisco!!
author: Bryan V.

description: delicious food, great waitress. I got the chirashi salmon bowl and it was probably one of the better ones I've had in awhile.  They also have some pretty creative rolls. It's a fairly small restaurant but sitting at the bar is very entertaining.
author: Patricia K.

description: I love this place. Great salmon sashimi. Cool sushi bar. Great service. Love having it in my neighborhood.
author: Zach T.

description: Small little sushi place but the food is so good!  I recommend getting there for happy hour because the spicy tuna hand rolls are the best I have ever had and for around $3 the price can't be beat!  Lovely atmosphere as well as a friendly staff.  Street parking wasn't an issue when I was there but it may be since it is located on popular and busy Chestnut St.
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
Small place, slightly upscale setting.

The menu seemed creative, but we must've picked the wrong dishes. The ahi tuna was OK, but the albacore tasted off.

Service was OK.
author: Johnson G.

description:
This place was Yummy!

My boyfriend and I came in here for happy hour after walking around The Palace of Fine Arts and the marina. We just happened to be walking by when I saw the amazing happy hour they had, and what made this place even better was that they had a vegetarian menu!! Yay!! It's so hard to find a sushi place that also caters to those of us who don't eat meat. 

The space is a little bit small, but we came in at the perfect time. It was pretty much completely empty when we walked in and got super busy after we had already ordered and received our food. I love when that happens! Anyways the service was great and our waitress was nice and really quick with everything. Of course we did see less of her when it got busy, but if we couldn't get a hold of her the other waitresses there would help us out no problem. 

Now on too the good stuff...FOOD!

I ordered the crunchy sweet potato roll and avocado roll. Both of the dishes was really good, and I absolutely loved trying a new roll (sweet potato). 

I'm not exactly sure what my boyfriend ordered, but I think one of the rolls was spicy tuna and he also got some miso soup. He really enjoyed the soup and the rolls, which I must say looked really good. From what he tells me the fish tasted fresh. 

I would definitely recommend this place! They even have a check in special which they accept during happy hour! (one free miso or edemmame order)
author: Toral S.

description: HH is a killer deal! One dollar nigiri, with generous portions of good quality, fresh fish. $5 poke salad was super tasty, $4 large hot sake, $2 Saporo, and other specials... Service was good - fast and friendly. They also had some interesting (non HH) seasonal fish and different toros on the specials menu.
author: Teuflin C.

description:
Sushi IN is a small cozy place, with nice servers, very limited seating, and mostly importantly, delicious unique rolls! The drink menu was fairly price too.

We started with the Tuna Tartarte, which was tasty, but didn't come with many wonton chips. I had the Firework Roll (spicy tuna, jalapeno, habenero, avacado etc.) and the African Spider (soft shell crab and imitation crab). Both were good and I appreciated that they weren't drenched in sauce, so I could actually enjoy the fish. There were more exciting rolls to pick from, and my friends both went that route and ordered the Pink Lady (mango, cream, cheese, some sorta kiwi sauce, and salmon), which they were impressed with. 

If I can stop myself from eating so much when I come back, will definitely try the green tea cheesecake!
author: Negien M.

description: Great happy hour prices! The Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll was my favorite.
author: Jena C.

description:
This is a hidden gem!  

The Nigiri ranks among the best I have had and we have tried all the top sushi restaurants in the city.  I definitely recommend sitting at the sushi bar and getting to know Jackie (sushi Chef and owner).  He is super friendly and takes great pride in his creations.  I also recommend getting the nightly specials which are always delicious or getting Jackie's opinion on what to order.  For rolls, the best and most original are the Iceland and the Fireworks roll.
author: Cindy O.

description:
When I got there I there was barely any people and that was fine by me because it was really small. It took a while for the waitress to come and give us water.

 The waitress was really kind and suggested a few rolls and I ordered the tuna roll, the firework roll, all which were really good. Though, if you want something really good you need to get the seared hamachi, it has to be one of the best sashimi I have ever tasted.
author: Grace W.

description: We used to come here consistently, but after noticing a new menu - with a new price hike to go with it - during our recent visit this past weekend, we were pretty disappointed. The sushi is fresh and we still love the food, but at these prices there are better sushi spots in the Marina.
author: Jess J.

description: Dropped into Sushi IN after the free food at an event wasn't enough for me. Ordered a philadelphia roll and two orders of nigiri. Fish was fresh enough, the service was quick and polite, and the hot tea was free. That's enough for four stars in my book.
author: Jenn C.

description: Totally average (SF average, which is above average in any places) in pretty much every way. Hard to opine otherwise.
author: Andrew K.

description: Really good sushi!! The music they were playing was really outdated but it was cute to listen to old Britney! The service was really slow I think they underestimated how much business they would have tonight because there was only one waitress & she was very sweet but clearly rushing. I loved all of the sushi though, especially the salmon.
author: Chessie C.

description:
We were in the area last weekend and came in because of a Yelp deal - we had no expectations and we were pleasantly surprised by this great find.  

The decor was a bit too trendy for our tastes and the prices are a bit high for a neighborhood sushi place (I think our bill came out $60 for two) but the fish was VERY fresh.  Definitely recommend getting a mix of sashimi, we were happy with everything we ordered - the uni was some of the freshest I've had in SF.  Their rolls and special creations (I think we got "winter and summer") were well done and worth a try as well.
author: Rosers M.

description:
Tasty, fresh, easy, and across the street!

Super nice staff - Fatima is a doll, as are all their waitresses. Jackie is a great sushi chef and has very light and tasty creations. I love the Aloha Island roll. Definitely one of my preferred spots for an easy dinner in the Marina, slash in the city for sushi.

They are fast, the fish is fresh, and nothing is slathered in sauce, like other sushi spots in the city. While they adhere to traditional fundamentals, they have a modern feel. It is sensible for first dates and friends catching up. Casual. I just wish they stayed open later.

Great sake selection as well.
author: Tammy H.

description: 49ers roll is our favorite. Great little place for Sushi in the Marina.
author: Daniel V.

description:
I ordered for delivery last week and I loved it. The food was at my door on-time...exactly what I ordered with utensils, soy sauce, wasabi. A star less since they forgot the napkins.

I got the hamachi carpaccio, firecracker and mango madness roll. All three were divine. the hamachi just melted in my mouth.

A place to count on for getting good sushi delivered.
author: Dee W.

description: Iceland roll was great. The edamame was not as warm as I prefer.... Staff was very friendly!
author: Wyatt T.

description:
Arrived at around 5:45 on a Sunday. Looked a little run down from the outside, but was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, simple, modern looking interior (not to mention a clean and updated bathroom!). Small place and not too many people there at 5:45, but by the time we left (around 7:30), there were people waiting to be seated.
Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and the food service was quick. I ordered the chicken teriyaki, avocado maki and shrimp tempura roll and all were very good. another friend ordered the sake don and said that it was delicious and she would highly recommend it. I would not recommend the beef teriyaki. It was tough and chewy. The banana tempura with ice cream was a special treat at the end of the meal. I would definitely go back again. :)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This place is awesome. Here's why:
-Great food. Jackie, the head chef, is incredibly talented and creative. I like to make sure that one of the rolls in any order is "Jackie's Choice."
-Great service. Smiles all around, quick water/drink refills.
-Rocking atmosphere. There's always upbeat lounge style music in the background, which is the perfect soundtrack for a dinner here.

I've introduced Sushi IN to a number of friends and will definitely continue to do so.
author: Ittai B.

description:
Actually I can't fully understand why people r raving about this place.
The location is okay - nothing fancy and kinda small.
The service is also okay ( I ordered water - got it warm without ice cubes ) and the waitress didn't pay that much attention but she seemed to be very friendly though.
And the food - well the sushi for sure isn't bad , but it's for sure also not the best I've ever eaten.. 
The fish seemed fresh and the sushi rice was well prepared but in my opinion they had few roll selections to chose from on their menu and there wasn't that much fish on the sushi. 
But it's fair because I didn't pay that much ( 18$ for a miso soup , California roll (6pc.) and 6 assorted Nigri sushi ) 
By the way their miso soup is very recommendable.
I'm not entirely sure whether I would return if I could ( I'm not from SF) that's why 3 stars.
author: Daniela F.

description:
Went here last minute with a group of 5 right before close.  They couldn't have been happier to serve us even though they were closing up.  

Everything was as fresh as it could've been.  The rolls were creative and the presentation was solid too.  I am really excited that they also offer free delivery.  My new go to sushi spot in the area.
author: Ian L.

description: Sushi In is really great. Don't judge it by the exterior--the sushi is excellent. The rolls are tasty and the nigiri is very fresh. Service is always friendly. Best of all, it's one of the few quiet places in the Marina. I eat here frequently and always have a good experience.
author: Jamon B.

description:
My One Word: Fresh!

Fact #1: The quality of the fish was amazing! 

Fact #2: Get free edamame or miso soup per person at the table who checks in.

Fact #3: Firework roll is really spicy and served with fire in the middle of the plate that last for 2 minutes.
author: Calvin T.

description: I went for the first time last night and had a great experience. We tried the hamachi carpaccio and the iceland roll and both of them were awesome.  The hamachi was sliced thinly and decorated with a ginger dressing - not too much but just right.  The menu has a nice combination of some creative sushi rolls and plenty of traditional Japanese favorites. Plus I liked the sake menu.  The presentation was great and the quality of the sushi was very good.  Its a nice tiny place - not much room but the sushi bar looked intimate and the staff was attentive and friendly.  I will definitely come back.
author: David Z.

description:
Sushi IN has great quality fish! The service is fantastic! The waitresses and chefs are so incredibly nice and friendly! I am from the beach cities in Los Angeles and was on vacation in San Francisco. My boyfriend and I wanted to explore the great food and restaurants of SF. Sushi In was close to our hotel and weren't sure if it would be good, but IT WAS! 
The sushi was beautiful and tasted fantastic! Next time I go back to SF I will definitely going back to Sushi In!
author: Darcey O.

description:
Pretty average sushi place.
Usually no wait.
author: Javier R.

description: Rolls were ok but the soft shell crab we could not eat, it was foul. We ordered food to be delivered and they forgot to pack soy sauce and chopsticks (neither of which we have). They also forgot to pack one of our miso soups that we paid for.
author: K C.

description:
Came here for a happy hour and I must say I love this place.  They have amazing deals and fresh fish!  The staff was wonderful and I had a super pleasant experience.

Dinner:
Baked mussels - super yummy. Comes with four pieces and just love the spicy mayo flavor!

Crunchy spicy tuna roll - topped with bits of tempura and teriyaki sauce. 

Crunchy Calirfornia roll - has fresh cucumber in it.  Very fresh!

Sashimi plate with Torro! - Torro is my favorite sashimi. Melts in your mouth good!

I like how they have a healthy section and serve brown rice.  Most places don't really serve brown rice and they have a very large vegetarian section as well.  Definitely will be back at this place again.  Great fish with great prices! Love that combo!
author: Ying F.

description:
We were so excited to see that this location was finally open!

It's been open about 4 weeks and we've eaten there twice and ordered take out once. They have the BEST California rolls and salmon sashmi. All the rolls are amazing and the prices are great. 

The atmosphere is modern, calm, clean and dimly lit. A nice relaxing sushi experience. The service is great and Teresa is super helpful!

If you haven't been in yet, GO!! You're missing out on all the yummy food!

Cheers!
author: Karri G.

description:
As other reviewers have posted, I was also interested in this location as I was a solid regular at Enoshima. I really tried to be impartial and not compare the two as they are very different but it was difficult.  

The food was very good, presentation was beautiful! The sushi was very pretty to look at and VERY fresh, some of the best I've had so I have no complaints about the food.

The atmosphere was clean and modern, I could have done without the house music playing in the background. Something more ambient would have been better.  It's just not good "digestion" music.  It was Saturday night but it was early enough to be before the club hopping starts.

It was busy but not packed.  Our waitress seemed to be in a hurry and actually made me nervous/ uncomfortable.  She was so efficient and seemed to be trying so hard that it was as if she were rushing us through our meal.  I  understand that on a Saturday night it may get busy later and it is a very small space but while we were there it would have been nice to not feel rushed.  

I hope they do well but I do miss the "homey" atmosphere of Enoshima, I miss James and Hideo, but I wish Sushi IN the best.  I will come back but can I have a different waitress?
author: Nicole C.

description:
I came to Sushi In for the first time since it was remodeled the other day.  I went for the happy hour and it was reasonable, even though it's still easy to rack up a big tab, because sushi isn't the most filling of food.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and the happy hour  ( $2 dollar hand rolls, $3 dollar rolls and cheap beer).  The sushi was good. I will be coming back for another Happy Hour experience.
author: Alex B.

description:
I was in the area with some friends and we saw the sign for "happy hour" on their sushi. We were all a bit tight on money at the time so happy hour sounded great. I was skeptical though because.... it's sushi. 

But am I glad I ate there. The server was soooo friendly! Forgot her name but she was a young pretty and happy girl. Great service. 

Collectively, we ordered the spicy tuna roll, crunchy California roll, Alaska roll, green tea cheesecake, fried banana with lychee ice cream, a glass of wine and two large sakes. The bill came out to under $40 for 3 people. 

One warning though. I had the spicy tuna roll and it was unbearably spicy. That was the spiciest spicy tuna roll I've ever tried. I personally thought it was too much. But everything else was great and delicious. 

Would definitely come here again, happy hour or not.
author: Sandra N.

description:
We really like this place.  We have ordered delivery from here many times before actually going to the restaurant.  We went the other night and it was great!

I love their Sushi IN Combination from the chef.  Very fresh and delicious.  I typically would be a little scared of eating uni at a sushi place if I was not 100% sure it is very fresh and we ordered the uni!  It was very fresh and delicious.

In the future, I would love to see this place rival Zushi Puzzle with items like live scallop and live uni.  Very fresh stuff - and perhaps some tasting menus of all 'sake' (the fish - not the wine) from different parts of the country/world.

We really like this place and will likely continue to use it as a our go-to spot.

oh -- fresh wasabi would be a great addition too!
author: Stephen S.

description: I tried their CA roll, spicy tuna roll, "Chestnut" roll with tuna, and the yasai sunomono; not all at once, of course ;) I'd say the sushi is decent for delivery, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine at their restaurant.
author: Tina A.

description: We love Sushi IN. It's our go-to for delivery, with fresh, consistent and delicious rolls. The only inconsistency is that sometimes it is even MORE delicious. My favorites are the hamachi green onion, spicy tuna and the mixed veggie roll.
author: Joan T.

description:
Stopped in for a little sushi one night.  I'll definitely be going back, but the location is really what the pull is for me.  

That said, there's all the basics.  You want Nigori (unfiltered sake)?  They have some.  A few specialty rolls?  They got that too.  Want something that's not on the menu?  They'll make that too.  

Great service, even though there's a small language barrier, the food is still pretty great.  You won't be surprised and you won't be let down.
author: Andy S.

description: Sushi in is my go-to sushi place around my apartment. I like the sushi here much better than Zushi Puzzle, believe it or not. Their miso soup is always good, uni always fresh and staff very friendly. It's no Sushi Yasuda or Azabu, but $8 for two pieces of uni nigiri (always consistently fresh) gets my vote. They have an omakase special where you can get 20 pieces of nigiri for ~$50 bucks - perfect to share between two people. Not sure how their business is actually doing, given no more than half the restaurant is filled at any time I've been for dinner. Downside is the decor - they're going for a retro, futuristic effect, with sake bottles backlit with different neon colored bulbs. Kind of tacky if you ask me, and not really a great spot for dates, but for a casual, quality sushi joint that stays open late? I'm in.
author: Nancy Y.

description: We had different Teriyaki and a big selection of fish and vegetarian sushi delivered. It all was great and very delicious. Fast, very friendly delivery. Would definitely recommend it.
author: Christian P.

description:
I like this restaurant because they have good quality sashimi and sushi as well as your standard teriyaki entrees like beef, chicken, salmon. My husband and I have different tastes when it comes to Japanese food. He loves raw fish and to me, it's "eh, whatevers". I'll eat it, but I don't love it. So, raw fish for me is a waste of mula. 

So, I ordered the beef teriyaki entree which came with miso, a side salad and of course the beef. I ordered it well, and it was slightly burned on some of the pieces (that is why I am giving 4 stars). Besides the burning, it was very tasty. I also had the garden lover's veggie roll, which was DELICIOUS! It had sweet potato tempura and the topping was the seaweed salad. My husband had a few nigiri pieces and said that the quality was good.

I noticed that they are on grubhub, so if I am too lazy to leave the house, I'll order my teriyaki from them!
author: Natalie S.

description: the place is okay, nothing special. Very very tiny .. the sushi are good. not planning to ocme back thouhg.
author: Lana G.

description:
while visiting San Francisco I came here on a Saturday with my mom dad brother and boyfriend. It is a very small restaurant. We arrived around 830 without a reservation or calling ahead. They only have one table that can accommodate more than 4 people so I would recommend calling ahead with a larger party. That being said they were very accommodating and gave us a call when our table was ready. 

The service was great I really wish I caught the name of our waitress she was very sweet and helpful. We ordered cold sake to start. Our server helped us pick out a cold sake. Apparently it won some type of competition in japan.

For food we ordered the scallop appetizer, firecracker roll, spicy tuna, toro nigiri, another roll with soft shell crab and my dad had beef teriyaki because he doesn't eat fish. The presentation was beautiful, extremely fresh fish and very delicious rolls. The flavors were really good and I really liked that the rolls were not smothered in sauce. The teriyaki dish came with miso soup and a salad. It was one of the best miso soups I have had in a while. Prices were decent. I will definitely be back to Sushi In the next time I am in San Francisco
author: Molly S.

description:
Amazing sushi! Honestly the best I've ever had. So fresh, innovative and delicious. Yum.

The presentation was stunning and the service impeccable! Such nice people. No pretension at all, just great, helpful attention.

You've got to try this place. Seriously!
author: Kelly M.

description: Not sure why this place has 4 stars, way overcooked soggy edamame, average sushi. A bit overpriced too
author: Erik G.

description: This place is pretty solid. It's really good for their 'happy hour' specials. Service is okay, and the place is ok for casual date nights.
author: Keith B.

description:
We decided to try Sushi IN on a random night and were pleasantly surprised. We opted to sit at the bar (my preferred sushi spot for two) and were so delighted by the friendliness of the staff and sushi chef. After a number of fresh sushi and a tasty rainbow roll, the chef suggest we try the White Tuna and it was amazing and so so fresh. He said he had it fresh and that if we liked the Salmon, we'd like this. He was right and it was great!

We'll have to try their delivery, but our experience at the bar was awesome! We'll be back! The only reason why I didn't give them 5 stars was because I did think the prices were a little high.
author: Francesca F.

description: Woohoo! As good as it gets! Amazing vegetarian selection of dishes. Can't wait to go back again and again and again.
author: Rae Ann D.

description: The food was good however I thought the proportions were extremely small. You can get more sushi for the same price at other places.
author: Diana F.

description: Great fish highly recommend happy hour! The hamachi carpaccio  plate is awesome get it, it's great! The crunchy spicy tuna roll and spicy tuna hand roll is good too.
author: Shannon C.

description:
We love Sushi IN!

This is our favorite place to go for date night. Small, not too loud, really fresh fish (no weird cheese melted on top here!), and the sushi chef always remembers us and asks where we've been.

And, they often have Super White Tuna as their "freshest"/catch of the day. Delicious sashimi. 

Also went here for my birthday, perfect for a group of 5-8, gets a little cramped after that.

I'd highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar and chatting with the head sushi chef, really kind, very helpful with making selections, and more fun than a normal table.

Perfect order:

Nigori Sake (unfiltered)
1 miso soup
1 Seaweed salad (very large size compared to most places)
Chef Sampler Sashimi
Caterpillar roll (can't resist the Unagi)
1 order of Super White Tuna Sashimi 

Comes out to about $65 for 2 people. Not a great price, but worth it for the quality and pretty on point for other places in the area including appetizers and drinks.

Will have to try their happy hour.
author: A G.

description: Really good food and pleasant service. Quite surprised by the salad which came with the salmon teriyaki combo. Not a tiny salad, for a change. And tasty rolls.
author: Damien D.

description:
This place is great! from service to the quality of food.  I haven't had a good sushi in a while and this definitely hit the spot .
The fireworks roll was real good with a good kick of spiciness.  Caterpillar and spicy tuna roll were great too.
author: T M.

description: I walked past not looking in for 4 years, then tried it one day and boy was I missing out. Good quality food, attention to detail and enough to satisfy the vegetarian (they even have a page in the menu for vegetarians). Nice range of saki and a list of special each night on the board.
author: Ross s.

description:
My friend brought me here because of the $10 for $20 Yelp deal. Upon finding out this place being located in the Marina area, I jumped into the conclusion that this must be somewhat of a "American-Japanese fusion" type of food. You know, where the sushi has overly drenched sauce, over sized avocado, mango, and all the other shit. 

Well what do you know, this place IS somewhat of a hybrid fusion. Just walking in, you'll notice that the soy sauce bottle is shaped like a teapot, which give sit a nice Japanese theme. But then it's not until you listen and notice that the background music playing is club music. Now that's an interesting mix, yeah, let's listen to some bass filled music with lyrics about sex, money, and drugs while eating sashimi and sushi. I don't know, maybe it's just me, but seeing how Japanese food tend to be "fresh" like being raw, not heavily flavored, mini portions, etc, I just don't see how these type of "heavy" music is able to blend into the food. I picture the sound of rivers flowing, koto playing, not this. But it's okay, perhaps I'm just overly traditional. 

Getting to the service, the waitress was really friendly. Always smiling, full of energy, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend food. Damn girl, if you weren't so innocent looking, I'd drop some perverted comments now. But too bad, you are. So I'll have to stop short and just say service here is good. 

The food itself was actually not bad at all. We ordered two "Westernized" rolls  - Iceland roll and Mango Madness. You know, that's the thing about these "Japanese" rolls. It isn't Japanese at all. 49er roll? Alaska roll? Iceland roll? Mango Madness? Yeah, you're sure going to find those in Japan. Why do that? Why not give us "real" Japanese rolls? I came here in hoping to dine on authentic Japanese food. I expected this place as a fusion, but technically they never listed themselves as a fusion. It's like bringing your parents to a Chinese restaurant then finding out they serve Panda Express type of food. Boy your parents would be PISSED. The fuck is this sweet and sour kung pao shit? Give me the god damn Peking Duck! Anyways, back to the two rolls I ordered; although it had sauce in it, it wasn't overly drenched. The flavor managed to merge together perfectly, and dipping it in soy sauce / wasabi didn't impact it negatively at all - instead it compliments it. The rice was firm and wasn't mushy, and you can separate the slices of the fish once it melts in your mouth. For a hybrid, this was pretty impressive. Oh, don't bother ordering their "special" item for the time being - Anago, aka salt water eel. I'm sure we all tried Unagi before, aka freshwater eel. I was wondering if Anago would taste any different. No, it doesn't, it tastes exactly like an Unagi - even the sauce and shit is the same. Even the texture, the color, the god damn size is the same. 

Oh, watch out for drinks that doesn't have a price tag to it. In the heat of the moment, I stupidly ordered two bottles of saki - "MIO Sparking Sake." Okay look, I wouldn't have lowered this place by -2 stars just because it was expensive - it was because of how it was advertised. In the picture, it shows a bottle of the sake, along with a glass that's as tall as the bottle. Common sense tells me that this is probably a one serve drink, two the most, hence I ordered 2 bottles, thinking it couldn't be that expensive. When the bottles came, the glass were tiny, literally, it's like half a shot cup in volume. Oh, and it's carbonated. Who the fuck kinda pussyass drinks carbonated sake off half a shot cup? Anyways, so the price came to $18 per bottle, not including the tax and tips. Yeah, definitely wasn't worth it. Alcohol content was a pathetic 5%, this shit is comparable to a Mike's Hard Lemonade, except that it's less volume, less alcohol content, and ~400% more expensive. Mix that with the deceptive advertisement and there you go, -2 stars. 

All in all, I'd say the food wasn't bad; I'd say above average. It definitely isn't authentic Japanese, but it's located in Marina after all. It's the pricing that bothered me - the bill came up to $100, and that's after the -$20 discount. That's just great, a $100 meal that doesn't fill you up.
author: Calvin D.

description: This is our favorite sushi place. It's really a hidden gem and the quality of the fish is superb. We always get the sashimi/nigiri - whatever's on the board and stacks of avocado maki. I have a soy and gluten allergy and Jacki - the owner/sushi chef totally accommodates me. For me, simplicity rules and less is more when it comes to quality and freshness. The service is great - both sides of the counter. Take out is great too, but we love to go in person and watch the game.
author: Renee J.

description: This is the best sushi in the marina. The specials menu is always changing with new rolls. I always sit at the counter and have Jackie make me whatever he wants. Haven't been disappointed yet.  Roll recommendations: fireworks if you like a little spice, negi monster, tko is another spicy roll and mango madness is a good sweet roll
author: Vince C.

description: This place is cute!  I called ahead on 4th of july with a large group (11+ people) and they saved us a table and were super accommodating with moving in additional tables.  Place is tiny so you can tell its not meant for huge groups.  We ordered the samurai roll and sushi dinner (spicy tuna roll w. nigiri) and while the pieces and nigiri were fairly small, it was yummy and fairly fresh.  I also really like the seasons appetizer where you can pick two out of four seasons (basically fish + special sauce) on spoons to try.  I guess for the Marina / Cow Hollow neighborhood the sushi is pretty decently priced, but I thought it was on the high side for such a casual joint.
author: Mengo Z.

description: The BEST sushi on Chestnut by far. I am obsessed with this place. They can make your rolls using cucumbers instead of rice. I order the spicy tuna with cucumber every time. It is amazing.
author: Brooke P.

description: I like this place. It is way better than Ace Wasabi or the other Sushi place down chestnut. The quality of the fish is good. The service is good for a chinese/korean owned sushi place. (chinese/korean is for some reason a common trend in owning sushi places I have noticed in the bay area... not sure why). The atmosphere is clean, bathroom is clean, the place does not smell. The rolls are really good. This place is open late night. They have/had a great deal on yelp. $10 for $20. I had a great dinner for only $10. unbeatable.
author: Alex Y.

description: Great little place that I recently tried for the first time. Quaint and cute, the sushi was fresh and delicious, nice staff, clean establishment. What more could you want in a sushi dinner?
author: Ashley M.

description: GREAT Delivery!!!  Seriously!  It's fresh and fast.  Sushi is one of those things that can be tricky for take-out.  Sushi In is the place to order if you want sushi at home!
author: Lexie S.

description: When I first took a look at the menu I thought it was very expensive, But the cuts of sushi are extremely fresh (just try the Uni to see). And the slices are very thick, which makes it worth the buck. I ordered the Chirashi sushi which was wonderfully overladen with a good assortment. My mother ordered the Salman Teriyaki and my sister ordered the Iceland Roll. Everyone enjoyed their meals immensely and service was fast and hospitable. Definitely a place I'd visit again.
author: Newton L.

description: So I found myself with a half an hour before I needed to be at a meeting, and decided to stop by Sushi In for my second time. I was surprised that the ownership recognized me and I ordered what I feel is their signature roll called "Firecracker". The novelty is that the plate is served with a flame on it. But really the roll is one of the tastiest rolls you'll ever have. Just before that I had the "NZ Tai" (Red Snapper) Most sushi chefs drown Red Snapper in Ponzu Sauce, but not here. Simply Awesome! Finished my quick stop with Halibut and Salmon Toro. Beyond like butter. The fish is always fresh and top caliber. And the family really cares about their customers, presentation and flavor of their dishes. I highly recommend this sushi restaurant.
author: Tony V.

description: This is not the cheapest Marina HH place, but for a Chinese run sushi bar it is actually pretty good. Excellent service by a hot Chinese waitress, good happy hour prices, but a limited HH menu. The dining room is small, with an interesting selection of electronic music playing. The food is decent to good.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: First time to this place and it was great - In my view the best sushi in the marina/cow hollow area.
author: Earl H.

description: Their Happy Hour deal is incredible. I had an absolutely amazing meal there for under $20. The staff is friendly and accessible, and the food was tremendous. I couldn't be happier with me experience. Even thought the Happy Hour nigiri and maki appeared a little smaller than their dinnertime counterparts, I left feeling full and sated.
author: West R.

description: Sub-par sushi as far as the city goes. To be fair, for the Marina it is one of the better locations. Just be careful, if you are accustom to some of the 4+ star sushi places scattered around the city, you will be disappointed with the quality.
author: Ninja R.

description:
I was really looking forward to visiting Enoshima sushi on my recent visit to the city.  I have been a long time customer of Enoshima, but since I moved away from the city last year, I haven't been there in a few months.  To my surprise, the business has changed hands and is no longer called Enoshima.  When I stopped by, I saw a crew of contractor remodeling the restaurant.  I had mixed feelings, since I have some attachment to the feel of the old Enoshima, but a cleaner, newer restaurant is always nice. 

A gentlemen came out and introduced himself as the new owner / chef.  He was very nice and excited to see old customers of Enoshima coming back.  His enthusiasm and passion definitely showed as he invited me to come back to their grand opening.  I don't know how everything will look or taste after the changes, but I am very excited to see a young business owner try to take this place to the next level.  Looking at the new menu and looking at some of the pictures of the rolls, I am super excited to come back to try to food.  I am picky about my sushi and I have very high hopes for this place after speaking to Jacky.  Good luck to Sushi IN!
author: Simon L.

description: Super delicious and fresh selection of sushi.  Also a nice array of sake.  Cozy setting and good service.
author: David P.

description: Fabulous little hole in the wall--fresh food, cute atmosphere and great/attentive service. Went with a friend and sat at the bar & loved our dinner
author: Jill G.

description: One of the few sushi places open on Sundays. Wasn't blown away by anything, but it scratched the itch...
author: Felix B.

description: This is a good place if you want cheap sushi.  The place is remodeled and is nice inside, but the service is very rushed.  I have been here a few times and every time I have been hawk eyed at each bite I took and the waitress kept coming by to try and take my plate....It was very uncomfortable and then after another roll was brought out the waitress moved all of my plates and soy sauce which I highly disgusted by since I saw her walk around touching and cleaning everything.  Not sure if I will return because the service was just unbelievable for a place that had 5 others in it and I felt like I had to stuff my face and leave.
author: Hillary B.

description: The restaurant itself is 3.5 stars, but the happy hour is a solid 5 stars. Fresh sushi that is extremely cheap for happy hour. We ordered 3 rolls, large hot sake and 2 small beers for under $20 for happy hour. If you are in the area before 6pm, I would definetly give it a shot
author: Katie D.

description:
the fish at sushi IN is some of the freshest I have ever had! The overall presentation of the food and quality of the fish really reflects the chef's passion for sushi...

The sashimi was thickly cut and delicious, but my other favorites were the eye catching fireworks roll (that actually comes out with fire on the plate!), and the gorgeous african spider roll...

I highly recommend this new place to sushi and sashimi lovers!
author: Sam S.

description: Pretty good. Very nice . Quick Delivery. My roommate and I love the spicy tuna with cucumber(no rice) rolls. We order all the time!!! I recommend it for sushi delivery!!!
author: Jen B.

description: Best sushi in the city. The Murray Roll is the best off the menu sushi roll. Hopefully it goes on the menu soon so everyone can enjoy it.
author: Sharam F.

description: Great sushi!  Took a little long to get food, but staff was very friendly.  The firework roll...Amazing!
author: Lisa B.

description: We went there for a quick bite. Sushi was ok, but nothing extraordinary. The place is small and somewhat dark.
author: Shirin E.

description: Great happy hour deals! M-F 4:30-6 - $2 small Sapporo or $4 large / $3 for the crunchy spicy tuna or crunchy California rolls / $2 & $3 hand rolls / $1 & $2 per piece of nigiri. Quality & service are always great!
author: Jill R.

description:
Fantastic service. Small and low key restaurant. Very good quality sushi, fair prices, and unusual but delicious spices. Top notch.
Extra point for the lounge-style music.
author: Bob G.

description: I continue to return to this spot for 3 reasons: 1) EXCELLENT FOOD 2) Really friendly staff 3) Great atmosphere inside, and of course they deliver in a timely fashion as well.
author: L H.

description: Everything was great and the service was super friendly.  The scallop lover was really interesting with the green apple flavor.  One criticism: The Sushi In Tartare was great, but the crispy wontons could have been crisper.
author: Ronan L.

description:
The sushi is good. and so is the beer and bananas foster. That's all I've had here. 

It's a bit small and starts to fill up on Saturdays around 6. Both times I've been here, the tables in the back (the ones that sit more than 2) were held for reservations. It's kinda whole-in-the-wall-ish but has nice decor and is kept clean. Servers are attentive and the sushi comes out with little delay. 

The sushi rolls taste just as good as they look. Fresh and creative and decently priced....and made by a real Japaneesy! I will definitely be coming back here whenever I need a sushi fix. 

On a side note, I've noticed people bring their kids here. some are loud, some are quiet, some stand in their chairs and play with their chopsticks. doesn't bother me but I know some people won't like it.

Enjoy!
author: JeF m.

description: Not a bad place, great service. But the sushi rolls were too small, I understand that tempura rolls were cheap but they shouldn't be so tiny, because i can get bigger in another place.
